intro: Cleistanthus mattangensis, commonly known as the Mattangensis cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for its potential medicinal properties.
